page.title: 10OFFCHURCH, ITS CHANGING FACE
page.content: {Offchurch, "the church founded or {owned by Offa",}has traditionally been associated with King Offa (757-769). { Legend}tells us that Offa's son or nephew, Fremund, was murdered and buried in Offchurch. Today local people recall the legend and the present Parish Church of St.Gregory serves as a reminder of the original church of the same name built by King Offa. {Older people,}natives of Offchurch, have noticed changes taking place. Once the inhabitants would have made their livelihood through agriculture but today most people find work away from the village.{ The Village School, {the Convent and the Post Office have {closed down.}As the village has expanded,{traffic}has increased and sadly there are{fewer trees}to be seen.
